title: ‘Constant mental harassment by office seniors’ led 55-year-old J-K man to suicide, 3 govt officials held: Police
text:
The case is being investigated by a team led by the SHO of Miran Sahib police station. A team from the Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL) was also called to the spot to inspect the scene and collect scientific evidence. (PTI Photo)

Three officials of the Jammu and Kashmir government’s Irrigation Department have been arrested after the death of a 55-year-old man, who worked as a helper at the department office and purportedly set himself on fire due to “constant mental harassment, allegedly by some of his office seniors”, police said on Saturday.

Puran Chand from R S Pura town near Jammu was found with severe burn injuries in the fields along the Ring Road at Prithvipur village on Monday. After passersby saw him and informed police, a team reached the spot and took him to hospital, where he later succumbed to his burn injuries.
